org.apache.oodt.commons.io

Interface LogListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventListener, PropertyChangeListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileLogger, LogEventMultiplexer, LogFilter, LogInit.EnterpriseLogFilter, MemoryLogger, ScreenLogger, WriterLogger

    public interface LogListener
extends PropertyChangeListener
    Listener for logging events. Objects of classes that implement this interface are notified when messages are logged and when other logging events occur.
    Author:
    Kelly
    See Also:
    Log, LogEvent

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void messageLogged(LogEvent event)
      A message got logged.
      void streamStarted(LogEvent event)
      A stream got started.
      void streamStopped(LogEvent event)
      A stream was stopped.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

        propertyChange

    • Method Detail

      • messageLogged

        void messageLogged(LogEvent event)
        A message got logged. The event contains the details of the message, including
        • The timestamp of the message, from LogEvent.getTimestamp().
        • The source of the message, from EventObject.getSource(), which is always a String.
        • The category of the message, from LogEvent.getCategory().
        • The message text, from LogEvent.getMessage().
        Parameters:
        event - The logging event.

      • streamStarted

        void streamStarted(LogEvent event)
        A stream got started. The event contains the details of stream start, including
        • The name of the stream, from LogEvent.getStream().
        • The time the stream got started, from LogEvent.getTimestamp()
        • The source of the new stream start, from EventObject.getSource() (always a String).
        Parameters:
        event - The logging event.

      • streamStopped

        void streamStopped(LogEvent event)
        A stream was stopped. The event contains the detail of the stream stop, which is the name of the stream, from LogEvent.getStream() or EventObject.getSource() (always a String).
        Parameters:
        event - The logging event.
